title: Regarding the issue of emails being sent to destinations other than their intended recipients when sending emails consecutively
content:
I followed the steps below on a Windows 11 device, Thunderbird 115.18.0esr, and the issue occurred as shown in the results. Is this an existing or new bug?

Also, are there any countermeasures?

<Procedure> ‚ë† Prepare a 6MB file ‚ë° Prepare 50 recipient addresses ‚ë¢ Prepare 5 CC addresses ‚ë£ Create 50 emails for each recipient (file: '‚ë†', CC: '‚ë¢') and save as drafts. ‚ë§ Copy the email created in '‚ë£' to Explorer. ‚ë• Select all '‚ë£' and press Enter to open 50 windows. ‚ë¶ Press the Mail button repeatedly from the top window to the top left. ‚ëß Drag and drop the email file from '‚ë§' into the draft and perform '‚ë•' and '‚ë¶'. ‚ë® Repeat '‚ëß'.

<Results> After approximately 70 attempts, we encountered issues where the sending process would not complete and the window would not close, and the email in that window would be sent to an address other than the one specified. The email was not sent to the correct address, so pressing Cancel and sending again worked correctly (sent to the correct recipient).

title: Authenticatie fout bij nieuwe account toevoegen
content:
Bij het toevoegen van een nieuw account wordt eerst gevraagd naar naam en mailadres. Ging prima. Dan volgt: Configuratie gevonden in de Mozilla-ISPDB Ik koos voor imap Volgende pagina: Uw aanmeldgegevens worden alleen lokaal op uw computer opgeslagen Dan geef ik het wachtwoord in dat ik juist nog gebruikt heb bij het inloggen van de webversie van de mail. Dan verschijnt Authenticatiefout, met als hint: Aanmelden bij server is niet mogelijk. Waarschijnlijk een onjuiste configuratie, gebruikersnaam of wachtwoord. Gebruikersnaam en wachtwoord zijn echt goed. Verder is er niets in te stellen geweest. Weet iemand waar dit fout gaat en nog belangrijker hoe dit op te lossen is?

Mvg

Rob

title: CalDav and CardDav autoconfig
content:
Hello. I'm trying to set up automatic config for DAV contacts and calendars located on my Nextcloud server. I've followed this doc: https://wiki.mozilla.org/Thunderbird:Autoconfiguration:ConfigFileFormat and I've managed to get at least the calendar to connect, but with one unfortunate condition: I have to open Thunderbird's about:config and set browser.opaqueResponseBlocking and browser.opaqueResponseBlocking.javascriptValidator to false.

Otherwise the request to DAV gets blocked by Thunderbird for some reason. Here is some information about my current setup: IMAP and SMTP servers are located at mail.mydomain.com, and email addresses look like user@mydomain.com. The webserver serving config-v1.1.xml is located there too, but it's behind a reverse proxy, which also proxies nextcloud.mydomain.com. When I add a new account to Thunderbird, it requests mydomain.com/.well-known/autoconfig/mail/config-v1.1.xml, so I've added a redirection rule on the reverse proxy which sends it to mail.mydomain.com and it seems to be working ok. I've added this section to the xml file: 

   <addressBook type="carddav">      <username>%EMAILLOCALPART%</username>      <authentication>http-basic</authentication>      <serverURL>https://nextcloud.mydomain.com/remote.php/dav/</serverURL>    </addressBook> 
   <calendar type="caldav">      <username>%EMAILLOCALPART%</username>      <authentication>http-basic</authentication>      <serverURL>https://nextcloud.mydomain.com/remote.php/dav/</serverURL>    </calendar>

(username on the Nextcloud matches the local part of the email address)

But looking at Network tab of the dev console I can still see that it's trying to get well-known dav from my top level domain. So I add redirection from there too: mydomain.com/.well-known/caldav -> https://nextcloud.mydomain.com mydomain.com/.well-known/carddav -> https://nextcloud.mydomain.com

Finally I can see the request is made to correct address: 207 PROPFIND nextcloud.mydomain.com/remote.php/dav But the icon shows it's blocked and there is a message in the JS console: The resource at ‚Äúhttps://nextcloud.mydomain.com/remote.php/dav‚Äù was blocked by OpaqueResponseBlocking. Reason: ‚Äúnosniff is true and mimeType is an opaque-blocklisted MIME type or its essence is 'text/plain'‚Äù.

I've found 2 settings I can switch off: browser.opaqueResponseBlocking = false browser.opaqueResponseBlocking.javascriptValidator = false And after that, viola - I can see my calendars showing up upon adding the account (but not contacts, I think it's a separate issue and I have to check everything).

My question is: is it possible to set this up without manually switching Thunderbird options on every machine? Some HTTP headers, perhaps?

title: Thunderbird Mail Stops sending Unsent Mail from the 'Local Folders - Outbox'
content:
We use the Add-On "Mail Merge" (https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/mail-merge/?src=search) to create lists for Outgoing mail.

It adds the individual messages to the Outbox and then when you "Send Unsent Mail", Thunderbird spools them one at a time.

Noticed with a recent update to 144.0.1 this behavior hangs. It will send out maybe 5 messages and then just stick at "Sending Message" under the Activity Manager view. If you close Thunderbird and the Activity Manager and reopen, you can then do "Send Unsent Mail" and another 5ish will send before the behavior repeats.

I attempted deleting the Global Database from Profile directory, rebuilding, uninstalling/reinstalling 144.0.1, eliminating AV scanning, turned off Indexing, emptied out directories, nothing seems to change the behavior. Sending individual messages works fine.

Rolled back Thunderbird to the 140.4.0esr release and the program will send normally without the hang. Updated to 141.4, also works fine. Updated to 142.4, this is the first version I see the behavior. I collected a Performance Profile which can be reviewed at https://share.firefox.dev/4nxcltl for the issue happening on the 142.4 version.
creator: winn_bt

title: Something changed about WebExtension API in Thunderbird 143 (inline images not showing with some addons)
content:
Hi!

I'm using an add-on (ReplyWithHeader) that modifies the header displayed when replying to or forwarding emails. I have this problem: since Thunderbird v143, inline images no longer appear ‚Äî they now point to an imap://fetch URL, so the images aren‚Äôt displayed. Several add-ons with similar functionality have the same issue. If you disable them, everything works fine (inline images are displayed correctly).

Developers of these add-ons say they rely on the WebExtension API (and probably the setComposeDetails function), so they can‚Äôt fix this on their side. Is there any way to confirm whether the Thunderbird API has changed since v140 (where these add-ons worked perfectly)? Could it be that, even if the issue seems to come from the add-on, there‚Äôs actually a bug in Thunderbird‚Äôs API?

If this isn‚Äôt the right place to ask about this, could you please tell me where I should post it?

I really need to modify the default reply header in Thunderbird, so this functionality is quite important to me.

Thanks in advance for your help!
creator: siempredyc

title: messages bounced for being over quota
content:
Just now, three messages were bounced from my Thunderbird inbox. The error message given was: A message was sent to you that was returned to the sender(bounced) because it would have caused your mailbox quota to be exceeded.

The following is the reason that the message was over quota: 

      Quota Type: bytes in the mailbox  Quota Available: 894.2KB      Total Quota: 5000000.0KB

There's very little in my Inbox, but there was a lot in trash and a bunch of sub-folders I didn't need anymore, so I deleted just about everything. The little indicator at the bottom right of the screen was still red, indicating excessive messages, so I closed Thunderbird and reopened it. The red indicator is still lit up like a Christmas tree, even though I've deleted hundreds of emails from all folders, but I resent the messages (these were between my Spectrum account and my Gmail account), and they still bounced. I then rewrote the emails, reducing the number/size of attachments, but they again bounced. Other emails from outside senders are coming through just fine. I also receive my gmail account via Thunderbird and it's behaving perfectly. It's just my Spectrum email account that's acting up, although as I said, email from outside senders are coming through without a problem.

I'm doing this on my desktop, Windows 10, current Thunderbird version. I didn't go to webmail to delete any of this. I don't understand why the indicator says I'm at 99% of my quota after so many deletions.

Any and all suggestions cheerfully received!!
creator: RoseQueen
